projects.name: Ebony Hotel Website (Frontend)
projects.description: A hotel website to showcase the hotel and its facilities, and also to allow the user to book a room.

tasks.name: Developed From Scratch: Leader & Reusability
tasks.description: Developed the frontend from scratch using Nuxt3 and TailwindCSS. Developed by a team of 2, and act as the leader. Developed by separating the website into components for reusability.

tasks.name: Developed Booking System
tasks.description: Developed room selection and user form to book a room and send the data to the backend.

projects.name: Money Backward
projects.description: An expense tracker to track your expenses and income. Originally built with Quasar & Golang, rewritten in SvelteKit for better developer experience.

tasks.name: OCR to extract amount from camera
tasks.description: Inputing amount manually every time is a pain, especially currencies with lots of zeroes like Rupiah (IDR). Implemented OCR to extract amount from camera and input it to the amount field.

tasks.name: Graph to help visualize the incomes/expenses
tasks.description: Use the graph to see the usage of your money, budget, and incomes.

tasks.name: Modern Tech Stack Application (V2)
tasks.description: Utilize tRPC for client-server communication, Drizzle as ORM, ShadCN as UI component library.

tasks.name: Infrastructure & Deployment
tasks.description: Started with AWS EC2 (Docker & Nginx). Migrated to Vercel (Frontend/API) + NeonDB (Postgres) + Posthog (Analytics) for serverless scalability.

projects.name: This Website
projects.description: The website you are seeing right now.

tasks.name: Deployment and Server Configuration
tasks.description: Deployed this project in a Digital Ocean's droplet (now in AWS EC2) and configuring everything required. Also Github Actions to automate deployment.

tasks.name: Implement Tracker
tasks.description: Implemented a tracker to track the user's interaction with the website using Posthog. No personal data is collected.

tasks.name: Sort Projects Type
tasks.description: Show projects ordered by priority list: fulltime, internship, school, personal

tasks.name: "Dynamic" Skills
tasks.description: Skills in the Skills section are retrieved from dedicated definition of skills and tech stacks in the projects section. The skills also could be clicked as a filter to show projects that use the skill.

projects.name: Software Engineer
projects.description: Handled various projects and tasks using various tech stack ranging from web app, desktop app, to internal utility app. Contributing to Engineering Excellence and Company-wide Improvements.

tasks.name: Leadership & Mentorship
tasks.description: Mentor peers about best practices and workflow improvements. Developed standardized software engineer interview guidelines (technical and non-technical criteria) to improve interview process.

tasks.name: CI/CD & DevOps
tasks.description: Implemented CI/CD and tools to help the team work faster, reducing manual deployment steps. Proposed and integrated tech tools to improve reliability and observability.

tasks.name: Generative AI Product
tasks.description: Collaborated cross-functional team to rapidly develop a generative AI product, with tight deadlines, working closely with AI tools.

projects.name: Melengo
projects.description: A generative AI project where I transitioned to a leadership role.

tasks.name: Project Leadership
tasks.description: Spearheaded a generative AI project, transitioning from individual web development to lead a 3-person team with tactical decision making.

tasks.name: Infrastructure Optimization
tasks.description: Re-architected serverless AI workers, significantly reducing failure rate from ±30% to ±5% and reducing daily GPU costs from $100+ to around $15.

tasks.name: Integration & Collaboration
tasks.description: Integrated third-party AI services, collaborated technically with the AI team and international stakeholders.

tasks.name: Quality Assurance
tasks.description: Improved code quality by doing code-review and implementing automated end-to-end testing, feature flags, and A/B testing strategies.

projects.name: Software Engineer Intern
projects.description: Enhanced an internal administration website made to score companies based on the items issued within the website.

tasks.name: Upgraded Role Based Access Control
tasks.description: Upgraded role based access control from 2 roles into 5 roles with each specialized permissions (e.g. role that only able to issue item but not edit, role that only able to edit, role that can do both).

tasks.name: Developed Item Approval System
tasks.description: Developed two-tier item approval system: "to be approved", and "approved" or "rejected". Only approved items are calculated in the scoring.

tasks.name: Updated The Scoring Calculation
tasks.description: Each item has different score and multiplier based on the category and sub-category. And the multiplier used also different if there is any item in certain categories. Yes, it's complicated!

tasks.name: Refactored Some Part of the Code Base
tasks.description: Maintainability is important! Refactored some of the functions and classes for the better maintainability, such as extracting repeatable logics into functions or putting constant items into list for easier change/scalability.

projects.name: Frontend Developer/Vice Head of Website Division
projects.description: Developed a website made to appreciate the ITB's July 2021 graduates.

tasks.name: Organize Frontend Team
tasks.description: Organized a team of five for the frontend part from developing the UI/UX to develop the website.

tasks.name: Message for The Graduates
tasks.description: Developed a one-direction messaging frontend for the public to give message to the graduates.

tasks.name: Initialized The Frontend Codebase
tasks.description: Set up custom scaffolding for the codebase, although never used React and Typescript before.

projects.name: StatsBot
projects.description: A Discord bot that shows statistics to a Discord server. A contribution to open source project as part of Hacktoberfest 2022.

tasks.name: Show Chess Leaderboard
tasks.description: Develop a feature to show the chess leaderboard by fetching chess.com's API and format the data.

projects.name: Development of Testing Module for Autonomous Tram Simulation Using CARLA Simulator
projects.description: A final project to develop a testing module for an autonomous tram simulation using CARLA Simulator.

tasks.name: Developed Various Testing Scenarios
tasks.description: Created diverse testing scenarios including time, weather, traffic, and specialized conditions.

tasks.name: Developed Tram Control Agent
tasks.description: Implemented a tram control interface and agent, enabling control via keyboard, another program as well as remote control via ZeroMQ.

tasks.name: Developed Scenario Composer
tasks.description: Designed a Python-based scenario composer to generate randomized route-testing scenarios for CARLA ScenarioRunner.

projects.name: Smart Room Air Conditioner
projects.description: An Internet-of-Things (IoT) project that monitors and controls the air condition in a room. This system consists of an embedded component, a website, and a machine learning module.

tasks.name: Item Selection Component
tasks.description: Developed a multi-option single-item selection component that hits an API on selection change (Frontend).

tasks.name: Realtime Application State
tasks.description: Developed websocket API to exchange real-time state of the application between the backend and the frontend (Fullstack).

tasks.name: Implemented ML Model
tasks.description: Implemented a TimeSeriesKMeans machine learning model to determine the air quality (Machine Learning). Also integrate the model by saving the trained model to file and using the model in the backend to determine the current condition.

tasks.name: Developed Initial Data Aggregation Pipeline
tasks.description: Developed a data pipeline from MQTT to PySpark aggregator to get current average value of the sensors.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.description: Python is my programming-mother-tongue. Since I was "born", I speak Python. (Obviously "born" as a programmer).

technologies.name: Javascript/Typescript
technologies.description: As Python is my Indonesian, Javascript/Typescript is my English. Not the most familiar, but confident enough to use it. Almost all non-personal-projects use Javascript/Typescript.

technologies.name: C#
technologies.description: Is this Java or C#? I don't know. Definitely love the verbosity of C#.

technologies.name: Git
technologies.description: Git is my middle name. Git for every project. Github is my best friend. Github Actions is my best friend's best friend.

technologies.name: Docker
technologies.description: Installing manually is a pain. Docker is the solution. Docker is the way. Don't need the program to run? Just stop the container.

technologies.name: Linux
technologies.description: Linux is my daily driver. My friend brought me down this rabbit hole. From Arch, to Fedora, now Pop!_OS, even my Server! But the rabbit hole is deep, I'm still learning.

technologies.name: SQL
technologies.description: SELECT currency, money FROM wallet WHERE name='Jeremia'; IDR "not much". Now I want to change the currency. Looking for a job abroad.
